UNITED NATIONS NATIONS UNIES
NEW YORK
13 October 1952
Mr. Prank Ec Schooley
Treasurer
National Association of Educational Broadcaster
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
I am glad to reply to your letter of October 9th
in which you asked my opinion regarding the ability, personality
and leadership of Professor Early Wynn.
I am happy to recommend to you my former colleague
and dear friend, Professor Early Wynn, formerly of the Department
of Dramatic Arts and Professor of Speech, and now Director
of the Communications Center at the University of North Carolina.
Professor Wynn is, in my opinion, highly qualified
to be the new Executive Director of the NAEB. He has character,
ability, personality, Imagination and leadership. His loyalty
is unquestioned. He served with the United States Navy in
the Second World War. He was long associated with Professor
Frederick H. Koch and with Professor Samuel Seldon. He has
good health, a good voice, and is an educational pioneer in the
field of dramatics, speech and broadcasting*
I would regret very much to see him leave the
University of North Carolina but, at the same time, I would
not wish to have him denied the opportunity which your
consideration would open to him*
Yours sincerely,
/s/ Frank P. Graham
Prank P. Graham
